author: A_Brickset_user
title: Fun to build!
review:
A two part review. 

First the X-Wing. Building the ship is not that difficult but there are several interesting aspects to this ship. First is the use of gears to open and close the wings. Similar to the UCS X-Wing, the gears are operated via a knob on the back of the ship. Hoever, this knob in not intergrated into the design on a good way; it sticks way out; but this can be fixed. Secondly, again simliar to the UCS ship is the use of hinges to recreate the angle of the nose of the ship. Two drawbacks are (1) the "landing gear" which is a disssappointment and (2) the bottom of the nose of the ship is open. Overall, an OK ship that is a step up from the old 7140 system set, borrowing aspects of the UCS X-Wing.

Yoda's Hut. Well, to me this is the actual gem of the set. Designed well with good details when you open it up(footlocker to keep lightsabre, cooking utensils). My only complaint is that instead of giving us only 1/2 of the hut, Lego could have easily included the back half the hut. Oh well, I guess I'm going to have to do some parts shopping to complete the back half myself!

Overall a good set, worthy of inclusion in anyones collection.

author: A_Brickset_user
title: Nice design and an excellent set!
review: When I got this set several weeks ago, I was hopping it would be a good set. Fortunatly, it was. I really enjoy the well designed main body and the nifty front, wings are nice too. I also really like color scheme. I still dont really care for Yoda's hut, though it is pretty nice. Overall, this is one of the better Star Wars sets and if you dont have yet, get it!!!!!!!

author: A_Brickset_user
title: best SW set of 2004 so far
review:
I just got this set for Christmas, and as a fan and owner of every Lego Star Wars set, I can honestly say this is one of the best sets to date.  The new X-Wing is more detailed and scaled than the old one.  It has a roomy storage bin underneath and the droid socket is much better than the original.  The wings are bigger, the engine is better, there is a cool mechanism for expanding the wings into attack position.  this is the most detailed Lego ship 
excluding the UCS sets.  The set also comes with Yoda and his hut.  It is pretty cool.  There is a hidden compartment under his bed where you can store his lightsaber.  Luke comes with a little back pack that you can attach Yoda to, but it is kind of a lame concept.  Other than that, this set is amazing.  If you only buy one Star Wars set this year, make it this one!

author: A_Brickset_user
title: Better than 7140
review: Way better than the 7140 X-Wing. Better proportioned and scaled. It should have been lt. grey instead of white and tan. Tan? What were they thinking. The second best part about it is that it comes with Yoda's hut. Gotta love Yoda.

author: A_Brickset_user
title: Great to build
review: Wonderful set.  Have both the original and now 3 of these.  This set is better to build the attack fleet out of.  Looks better without all the moss items in place.  Yoda hut is a tad cheesy, but it adds a few hard to find parts.  Overall a must have.

author: A_Brickset_user
title: The X-wing was made to be white.
review: I like the white in this set, its better then grey besauce white makes it look cleaner and it brings out other colours also. I think the new X-wing is more well put together then the first one from looks (but I never owned the first one so I wouldnt know) It looks alot more accurate and just all around btter then the origanal. I also like that they added Yodas hut in this set, sure it might be more about $20 more expensive but its worth it.   15/10 because The X-wing is just cool

author: A_Brickset_user
title: Almost didn't buy this one, but I'm glad I did
review:
I only picked this one up because I found it for roughly half the RRP on eBay, but I'm glad I did.  It's soooo much better than the original X-Wing (7140), more detail, bigger, better wing mechanism (if a little slow) and R2 is enclosed now, Another Luke (albeit in different garb) figure and a Yoda (with normal-sized lightsabre - it should have been half-sized).

Very impressed with the construction of the nose - has a nice angled shape rather than the boxy one of the first model.

My only complaint is that the compartment on the underside doesn't sit against the fuselage and the lightsabre (if you keep it there) can fall out during flight.

I don't necessarily think that the price is right, but it's a cool set, no doubt.

author: A_Brickset_user
title: Never judge a model by the box art.
review: I had this set for some time, but never felt inspired to make it - preferring other things like the AT - TE. I put this down to the picture on the box - which is uninspiring and certainly does not do it justice. I think it would be better if they used a picture of it in combat rather than raising out of the swamp - surely no - one is going to stick the green things on their X - wing anyway! When I ran out of other SW sets to make I decided to go for it. I was pleasantly surprised to find that this is a really good set and pretty close to the UCS set (which i do not own) at a fraction of the cost. It appears to be very accurate and the way the wings open has not failed to impress anyone i have shown so far. Love the colours which also look too bright on the box. I now really like this model which has benefited from a couple of very minor modifications (that i always do to obtain improved accuracy) and wish i had not had such a downer on it. Yodas hut is OK if you want that, but i just wanted a cool looking X wing. Would have been better with additional luke minifig in his orange flight suit so you could put him in the cockpit. I have put in a spare orange luke, but he does not sit comfortably as it is obvious the cockpit was not designed for occupation. R2 D2 also benefits from being raised by one clip height to make it that little more prominent like in the films and UCS version. Have added landing skids to bottom engine nacells where they should be and removed skids from rear fuselage. These mods could have been made by lego at virtually no extra cost as the number of bricks removed is the same as those replaced. Still pretty good though.

author: A_Brickset_user
title: Excellent wing sistem
review: I dont have the old one, but i think this is better, the Wings, movemment it is amazing, the white color is very cool, and the litle Yoda House it is a grat detail, the only think I dont like is the green stoff of the X -Wing, but I dident put them, it Deserve a 10

author: A_Brickset_user
title: Great!  A bit too much $$
review:
I got this yesterday, and I kind of regretted it until I built it!  The pic on the front is SO unflattering.  
I really like how there is a cockpit, a storage place, a place for the droid, and how the wings open.  I kind of wish he was wearing the orange suit, because this is my first star wars set and I don't have any others.
I really like the Yoda fig.
The hut is really cool too, how it opens up.

In conclusion, a great set, though a bit pricy!! (70$$ Canadian)

author: A_Brickset_user
title: Best set ever
review:
Okay, got this on ebay 2 weeks ago, took a while shipping...anyway, I don't have much more to say cause everything has already been said!

Don't pay any attention to the pic on the box, it sucks and really doesn't value the set itself...so don't care if it looks crappy, cause once you've build it up, it's worth the look!

Compared to the ancient x-wing sets, this one is much longer and a little larger, and just better. compare it to a picture of the "real" x-wing, you'll see how good it was recreated by Lego.

The system to open the wings is ingenious, and I admit it, better than the previous one. Colors are quite nice, and Yoda's just the best minifig ^^. His hut is also well moddled.

All in all the best lego set I own! Go buy it, you won't be disapointed!

author: A_Brickset_user
title: Perfect
review:
I just had to review this 
It's just Perfect 
This is my first X wing so I can't compare to the older one's but I don't care I know this is the better one
Normal I wouldn't buy this beacause and this is my only con

author: A_Brickset_user
title: awsome, but why white?
review: this set is awsome in almost every way possible; exept the color.and the fact it is pretty much a worse ucs. x-wings are grey, so white just messes it up, and theres a copit on the bottem, just like the ucs. but overall, its pretty cool.

author: A_Brickset_user
title: Fighter Jock's Fighter
review: This was almost the best Christmas gift ever!  I have never seen a more remarkable image of an X-wing snubfighter! You use a variety of new and unique pieces to merge into a beautiful X-wing model! My parents couldnt believe how good this was, and you wont either if you build this baby! The cockpit has the average Death Star trench screen and unbelievably, a control stick, I mean, how super is that!  The wings are longer and the nose is longer and more pointy than the older 7140 X-wing. This is a defenate MUST HAVE and the detail is just Incredible with the capital "I".  You also get an annoying Yoda's hut but more lego's are the best. The luke doesnt come in an orange flight suit but does come with a helmet. Strap in and go destroy some TIE fighters! It is a pretty naughty 49.99 USD, but this IS a 10! Get it this 500th of a second!

author: A_Brickset_user
title: A Very Good Star Wars Set for ANY Star Wars Fan!
review: I bought this set in a discount store for a bargain price.  It took me almost 2 hours to assemble this set, but when it was assembled it was incredible.  I am very pleased to know that LEGO owns most of the rights to sell the Star Wars series.  I'm not at all a Star Wars fan nor did I see the movies, but being a LEGO fanatic I knew this had to be added to my collection.  I was very pleased with what this set series came with.  It's much worth more than $50 and if you get it at $50 that still is a BARGAIN price for this set.  If you are a Star Wars fan, you'll love this set.  LEGO keep up the good work!

author: A_Brickset_user
title: this...doesnt need anything else!
review:
im all about quantity, but this set takes first place!
  i mean it really is perfect, yoda's hut, luke, R2, X-wing
just everything!  i got it for Christmas (yes, again) and i was overwhelmed when i saw it.  i built it, and it is now a new addition to my gargantuin collection.  you really cant not love this set.



overall

perfect

author: A_Brickset_user
title: build today
review:
If I had rated the old 7140 with a 8/10 this set would be a 11/10. No kidding. This time the lego devellopers have gone beyond my imagination what is possible to make with lego. First the nose has the perfect shape like the real one. Second the technique they used for the extraction of the x-wings is beautiful made. Looks like a gearbox inside. The X-wing is also in scale with the figures, the older wasn't. Third thing is the bagage case under the plane.
More nice items in this set are the little yoda, which is smaller than normal minifigs! And his circular house.
Go an buy this one. I got it for only $36, but it's worth the double.

author: A_Brickset_user
title: Incredible Model!
review: This is a nice set and it is greatly improved from the last one! It has a longer nose and larger wings! Under the nose is a luggage compartment and landing gear that actually retracts! It is very sturdy and uses a very complex and nice gadget to open and close the s-foils! The laser cannons on the wings are also a nice detail! R2-D2 has a nice inclosed place to fly in and the cockpit has a joystick and a control panel, but it is a little bit cramped! The back is is nice and the engine details are even nicer! This is a great set and Yodas Hut isnt all that bad either! I would toss the Yoda minifig however! This is an allstar set and I recommend getting it with any 50 dollars you have saved up!!!!

author: A_Brickset_user
title: yeah
review: Just got it, I love the minifigs, but the colours on the ship are a bit weird looking, but I guess it's better than having those giant moulded pieces which make it like any ordinary model and not lego.

author: A_Brickset_user
title: GO GET IT!
review:
go get it,build it,have fun having it,then go buy another one for bricks!This one rocks (and there is no single sticker!).
I wish Lego would make A-wing , B-wing and Y-wing in this quality!
this one is awesome for a toy.

author: A_Brickset_user
title: No green stuff on my x wing
review:
none of the green stuff is on my fleet of x-wings, boys! Awesome set. I just wish yoda could bend his legs. then, it would have been a 12 out of 10. 
I added two little buttons on the bottom so its stands nicer with the landing leg. 
Unlike many people here, I like the white. Brings out the red better.

author: A_Brickset_user
title: X-Wing Fighter
review:
The original X-Wing released in 1999 will always have a special place in my heart, being one of my first Lego sets from the Star Wars line, and a near-perfect rendition of the real thing. When the new X-Wing came out, I was unsure whether to buy it or not, but upon completion glad that I did. The set is just as sturdy, but was a lot sleeker, better colour scheme and featured both retractable landing gear and opening wings. Yoda's hut was also a nice addition. For me this ranks along the top with the original X-Wing as one of the best sets in the Star Wars line.

Pros:
* Luke Skywalker and Yoda minifigures
* Retractable front landing gear
* Mechanism that opens/closes the wings
* Lots of detail both on the fighter and inside the hut
* Very sturdy

Cons:
None

author: A_Brickset_user
title: AWESOME SET!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
review: i got this like a month ago but i never get bored of it! it is fun and a worth the money when you realize it come with yodas hut! youll never get bored-BUY IT NOW!!!!!!!!!!!!(or youll regret it when its not out of stock;) )

author: A_Brickset_user
title: It's OK but the old one is better.
review: I really only bought this for Yoda's hut.Now about the X-Wing,the whole thing is to big,the colour is wrong and the nose of the ship is so ugly.Also why does Luke come with a green lightsaber? he would had a blue one when he meet Yoda the first time and crashed.

author: A_Brickset_user
title: dont trust anyone example:star wars lego collector(not a real one)
review: i have that x-wing set and he gets green saber like after awhile, HES SUPPOSE TO HAVE IT!(not in episode 4). Anyway this set rocks it has and never gets boring. Its a bit pricy they should take 5$ off it, but it still rocks- 9.6(rounded to 10). Well get it, and ignore idiots who tell you what not to do and what to do(listen to yourself, i regret alot of things cause i did that).

author: A_Brickset_user
title: popsicle does not know Star Wars.
review: Fisrt of all i acree with what Star Wars lego collector says and he's right Luke had a blue lightsaber when he first met Yoda in episode 5 then he left and when he was fighting Vader that was when lost his lightsaber so for episode 6 he bluit a new green one.And you know that this set is from episode 5 because if it wasn't the X wing wouldn't come with the viens and Luke wouldn't be waring that shrit.

author: A_Brickset_user
title: SUPERB!!!
review: I got this set as a christmas present and has been my fave since.yodas hut really really needs a back while the x-wing couldnt get any better. I give this one a five, because it has some playtime value.

author: _add_um
title: One of my favorites!
review:
After playing Battlefront 1, I wanted a X-wing and with my birthday around the corner this is 1 set I knew I was adding to my collection. I Just love this set! Nice minifigs too.

Pros:
* all new Luke minifig
* Yoda's hut
* bigger scale X-wing

cons:
* luke has a green lightsaber when it should be blue
* No luke in his orange jumpsuit (luckely I had 4500)

A must have set for any Star Wars fan and with 6212 in shops you can still get this great ship.

author: Leggodt94
title: Loved it!
review: This set is awsome! I am so glad that lego decided to relocate the X-wing to this scene. The X-wing's design is better than ever, the minifig dagobah luke is awsome, and the yoda hut makes this set a must have! But I did have one concern, luke is supposed to have a blue lightsaber not a green one. Other than that, it's an awsome set.

author: Pepper
title: great
review:
I got this set for Christmas in 2003. Onto the pros. and cons.

Pros.
good design
cool minifigs (Yoda, Luke, and R2-D2)
2 lightsabers
Yoda can store his lightsaber under his bed
storage compartment in X-Wing
wings open
X-Wing Pilot helmet for Luke

Cons.
seaweed on the X-Wing
Luke's lightsaber should be blue instead of green
Luke doesn't fit in cockpit very well

Overall, great set, I like it alot.

author: petro17sq
title: Great wings system
review:
I love the way Lego is combining technic pieces in some of the star wars sets, this is a great example of that.
The wings open and close in a very cleaver way when you turn a circle brick in the back of the X-wing fighter.
The fighter is amazing, I did not have the change to purchase the first X -wing set, but this one is better plus you have a bonus with the small Yoda house.
The only thing I donâ€™t like are the green plant in the fighter wings, but that is the magic of Lego if you want you can changed it.

author: hustla187
title: Not as Good as the Original
review: I got this set for Christmas in 2003. I wanted it for Yoda's hut, but I realized for the first time that Lego was making vehicles that already made in past sets. I didn't like that at all. I later retuned this set and realized I made a good choice and not blowing money on something that I already have. What I'm trying to say is that this set wasn't as good as the original.

author: Smallsam99
title: luke use the force and run, run to dagobah, run to dagobah!
review:
This set is very cool and best of all I got this set for only 15.00! I like the design of the x-wing and it actually holds the lightsaber. The cockpit was well designed along with the wings details. I think that however the wings come undone very easily! The set also has a very rare Yoda minifig. I like the hut and think it captures the feel but needed the trees and bushes. Also a bat and snake wouldn't have been bad. However it is a very good set with lots of pluses!
pros: new x-wing

yoda and his hut

luke on dagobah with helmet and hair

cockpit

two lightsabers 

r2-d2

cons: luke's lightsaber needed to be blue

needed more scenery

Overall I love the set and think it is swell. I rate it about a 9/10. I reccomend getting it for about 40-65 dollars but you probably won't find it that cheap.

author: obiwantrav917
title: Great set
review:
Awsome

everthing is great 

Pros

great x-wing
great hut which can open and close
backpack for luke
Yoda has hidden light sabber

cons

absolutly none!

This is one of the best sets i have seen

author: rabk295
title: Good set, but get the new one.
review: This set is good, but get the new one. This set is great and if you really want the Yoda, Daghoba Luke and Yoda hut, then get this, but I recommend the newer one. It has more minifigs, and a slightly updated X-wing. If you don't want that, get this. But if you're buying it for a crazy price, it's not worth it.

author: guybrush_threepwood2
title: this is an awsome X-wing fighter
review:
this set is much better than 7140.
it has lots of details like the opening wings, detailed cockpit, and rare mini figs.
I would like to combine this set with 7130 snow speeder. if you love the epic tale  of  episode 5 like I do,this set is a must have.

author: Yoda____
title: great hut
review:
The hut is by far the best part of this set. It has no flaws and lego should release it on it's own.
The X-Wing however looks dumb. It's great, even the swamp pieces don't bother me (i put them on my custom base) but then the wings are way too short. They sould be slightly shorter. Longer than this but shorter than the arc 170 (the arc 170 starfighter doesn't look bad bad but that length on an x-wing would look almost as dumb as it does now.

author: BionicleBOOM
title: Nice!
review:
I got it for Christmas one year, and I tried building it at my grandparents, but had to go home to build the rest, in the process losing that hinged piece that lets you lift up the tree roots from the roof of the hut. :( I had plenty extras, luckily.
Anyway, what about the actual set?  It's a nice one, playability is AWESOME, and MOCing (though I haven't got around to MOCing this set) looks pretty good.  5/5.  It includes Luke's lightsaber (but it's GREEN, not like the blue in the movie), some hair headgear if you wanna take his flight helmet off, and a backpack to snap on his back.  Yoda has his gimer stick, a lightsaber hidden under his bed, and various other articles of living in his hut (pot, barrel, table, etc.).  Artoo is just a normal Artoo.

Pros:

-X-WING is AWESOME

-Yoda's hut is detailed well, but Artoo can fit inside, unlike the movie...

-You can clip slime onto the X-wing to raise it from the swamp

Cons:

-Green lightsaber for Luke

-A little inaccurate

Overall, good set 5/5.

author: MasterBuilder
title: Nice
review:
Great set, the swamp sea-grass hanging on the X-Wing is a very nice detail. Yoda's hut is expertly designed, and even though it is a little small on the interior, you can "open" the back to play with it. The X-Wing's wings are pretty cool because you can toggle them into combat position and back to flight position. Overall a really great set. Luke is very well built, especially because he has a backpack thing that he trains with, just like in the movie.

The bad parts, though not many, are only my opinions. Firstly, I don't like how Yoda's legs don't move, especially because he is like the most ownage Jedi, so it greatly decreases his "minifigureness". The only other comment I really have on this set is that the wings on the ship, when changing the position, it moves kind of slowly so you cannot quickly shift in and out of combat. This greatly degrades the playability of this set, but is still a very good model if you are a collector. 

Overall, this set is great, again, because it has two main structures, and R2-D2, an astromech droid not included in many sets.

author: Kalhiki
title: Yoda's first appearence in the movies
review:
The hut is beautifully made. It's got alot of detail. The ack is open, though, but it really serves no purpose as it has little room folded up. It does have the feature of opening giving you more room to play. I know it has a bed (with a secret compartment) a barrel, and a small stove. Not much else.
The X-Wing is also very good. It does have the function (though it takes a while) to open the wings making the X which it was named after. It also has plant gunk hanging off of it which can easily come off. It's got landing gear, opening cockpit wih plenty of room inside, and an opening back. I do belive the back shows the gear to turn to open the wings.
Overall a great set. Great detail, and appealing appearence. Definately a set to get.

author: Diska
title: One of the Best Star Wars sets I've ever bought!
review:
This is a very good set. I got it when I was about 12, six years ago and from my experience it one of the best Star Wars Lego Sets ever made. I saved up all my money and got it for the good price of $50 at a local Wal-mart. 

First of all, I love the design of the X-wing. It's quite solid, can be divided easily into two big parts (so Luke can crash land with the cockpit if you want), and it has gears to allow the wings to open and close. Very good, and the color scheme is visually pleasing. Luke easily fits into the cockpit and just his head shows, so it seems very realistic as well. I am not as big of a fan of the white-colored cockpit glass which is a cargo bay for his lightsaber, as it tends to hang loose from the ship. I also like the landing gear and the very well=designed nose of the ship. 

Yoda's hut is very cool as well, and it can be opened easily. It's very accurate to the movie, with a lot of detail, such as the pot on the stove and the cup.  You can even hide his lightsaber (never seen in Ep. V) in his bed, and he also comes with a brown staff. 

The minifigs are quite good, except that R2-D2 is very common. Dagobah Luke is very cool, but I really think they should include Luke's pilot outfit as well since they already have the helmet. I was very upset to find this out as a kid after I bought the set, since I thought Pilot Luke was awesome. Yoda is very cool, and he only appears in two other sets in this variant, so it's good to have him. 

The best thing about this set is that Lego couldn't seem to find many ways to make the X-Wing any better, since their latest version is essentially the exact same set without Yoda and his hut, and with a few other minifigs. 

Overall, a must-have for any Lego Star Wars collection, and great for kids too! I'd personally recommend this to all buyers.

author: theModernYoda
title: A Great Ep.5 Xwing Fighter
review:
This is a very good set, as similar as possible to the movie. It stays together very well. Making yodas hut and vines on the ship was some pretty smart thinking, as well as the backpack yoda can be placed on. Easy to build. Turn the wheel on the back to split the wings to attack position.

Pros:

  • Yoda
  • Yodas hut
  • adjustable wings
  • good playability

Cons:

  • Luke has yellow skin

  • Needs a Pilot Luke minifig

Overall, its a 9/10.

author: Askora09
title: X wing and Yodas hut
review:
Building

        The building experience is actually quite dificult with the X-Wing. If you mess up at all you have to start over. And sometimes the wings fall off if you bump them. Yoda's hut is decent to build.

       

                                               Parts

                   With the X-Wing, You don't get a lot of basic parts. It is actually quite nice. Most come in handy if you want to build something else. Yoda's hut, same thing.

 

                                                playability

                     There is a lot you can do with this set. If you buy Darth Vader's Tie Fighter then you can have the Death Star battle and the battle on dagubahh. Or you can have the X-Wing crash into Yoda's hut and yoda kill luke.

 

                                                      Price

                 Nowdays you can not buy this big of a set for 40 bucks. Plain and simple. Right now on Amazon it is going for $200. It is also the only set w/ Yoda's Hut. My suggustion, if it goes down buy it.

 

                                                     Pros  

  •                                       Yoda's Hut
  •                                       X-wing
  •                                       Yoda
  •                                      Luke in tank top
  •                                            

  •                                               cons

  •                                     no vader
  •                                    no blue lightsaber
  •                                     Ghost kenobi

author: rr211
title: a long time ago in a galaxy far far away!
review:
I got this with the homing spider droid no minfigs or yodas hut for Â£20!

building experience

parts

the wings can be used for lots of things from midi scale venetors, to decks on pirate ships. yoda's hut looks as if it has tons of cool bricks.

i got yoda from the AAT.

 

  • pros

author: whtknt
title: Fun to assemble
review:
I was quite pleased with this set, the complexity of which surprised me. I have seen other X-Wing fighter sets that are not nearly as detailed or handled so neatly. At several points during assembly, I questioned the design of the kit, thinking that once fully assembled, it would prove flimsy or would not hold it's shape, but the designers surprised me and accomplished some remarkable things. The wings of the fighter open and close, and stay in the position they are placed in (thanks to some ingenious use of elastic bands), which makes it great for display, whether on a static surface or suspended from a line. Yoda's hut folds in upon itself to form a nice, compact little dwelling, but smoothly opens out to expand to a full playset!

The level of skill required to build this kit is not high, but there are a lot of pieces, many of which must be assembled in exactly the manner shown for things to work.

Pros

  • One of the only sets I know of to include Luke in Dagobah fatigues
  • I love the way that Yoda's tiny hut opens out to a full playset
  • X-wing can be covered in swamp grass or left pristine
  • Little details like the secret compartment in the X-wing and the one in Yoda's hut

Cons

  • The level of detail on R2-D2 is not up to par with other sets
  • The only thing missing is the testing tree with a Darth Vader figure

Overall, a nice set that any Star Wars fan would be proud to own. If you are more into playing than collecting, then this set will give you hours of fun letting Luke train with the master of the Force on Dagobah, and it's flexible enough to let you make a number of other designs, even with no other kits.
